clues.text: Linguist Marc Okrand created this language spoken by Worf (among others) on television
You can be like Daenerys & actually learn about 4,000 words of this language of Khal Drogo
Harry Potter acquired the ability to speak this language of snakes from Voldemort
Tolkien created this language whose forms include Quenya before writing his books, not the other way around
This language in "Avatar" was created by linguist Paul Frommer & consists of several thousand words
Sage advice from Fran Lebowitz: "Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's" doing this
When asked what his favorite one of these was, Jack Palance joked, "Poppy seed"
H.L. Mencken defined Puritanism as "the haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be" this word
Attributed to Jeremy Bentham: these are "the only persons in whom ignorance of the law is not punished"
Eubie Blake, 1887-1983, is among those credited with "If I'd known I was gonna live this long", he'd have done this
Venus & Serena grew up in this huge city's suburb of Compton, better known for rappers than groundstrokers
Venus took the 2000 & 2001 singles titles at this British Grand Slam event
In 2001 the Williams sisters got "animated" on the court in the "Tennis the Menace" episode of this Fox series
In 2003 Serena completed a "Serena Slam", beating Venus 7-6, 3-6, 6-4 at this event in Melbourne
The way this dad of Venus & Serena managed their careers brought some criticism, but turned out pretty well
Homer begins this epic poem by telling us it's about the anger of Achilles
Louis de Pointe du Lac, not Lestat, is the title undead being queried in this novel
For telling the truth about a town's contaminated water supply in an Ibsen play, Dr. Thomas Stockmann becomes this title foe
"A drowsy numbness pains my sense, as though of hemlock I had drunk" is a line from his "Ode to a Nightingale"
In this 1948 Shirley Jackson short story, a village selects a sacrificial stoning victim to ensure a good harvest
Weber State is near a "Great" lake in this state
It's the state of Wayne State University, attended by Jack White, Lily Tomlin & Steven Dorfman
Muncie in this state is home to Ball State University
Tufts is a centerpiece of Medford in this state
The Campbell Fighting Camels are from near the Cape Fear River in this state
It's a pendular timepiece with a case as tall as or taller than a person
In 1917 he founded Boys Town in Omaha, open to boys of all races & religions
Seen riding a flying gander, this character is usually traced back to a 1697 book by Charles Perrault
Covered in hair from head to foot, this member of "The Addams Family" spoke in a language all his own
This first novel by Theodore Dreiser tells of a young woman's rise to become a successful Broadway actress

rounds.comments: (Ken: Please rearrange the mess we made in each of these clues into the correct proverb.)

clues.text: Son father like like
Words louder than actions speak
From a blood stone you get can't
clues.response: you can't get blood from a stone

clues.text: Bright on the always side look
clues.response: always look on the bright side

clues.text: Never better than late
He soulfully sang it's a "man's world, but it wouldn't be nothing, nothing without a woman or a girl"
Referring to the nickname "Governor Moonbeam", he says, "I've earned that moniker"
He said he knew "slave-holders" would not give up their slaves "till they felt a big stick about their heads"
Before he became U.K. prime minister, he said economic & "environmental objectives now... reinforce each other"
She ran Vanity Fair & the Daily Beast but said, "I didn't see myself as an editor. I wanted to be a playwright"
Before she was a pretty woman, this actress mopped the floor of the title joint in "Mystic Pizza"
Later movies in the "Rocky" oeuvre include scenes in the restaurant Mr. Balboa opened & named for her
Danny Aiello awkwardly proposes to Cher in an Italian restaurant in this 1987 film
Mookie throws a trash can through the window of Sal's Famous Pizzeria in Brooklyn in this 1989 film
In the final scene of this film, Secondo makes a frittata for Brother Primo in the Paradise restaurant
Bread, as the mainstay of the human diet, is known as this
A source of rescue in a crisis; phone a friend is one example
Alliterative term used to publicize a circus performer who puts himself at great risk
Though they sound like they sit on the beach, they're the senior British army regiment & first saw action in the 1600s
One of the Arabian Nights begins with a proud king who's not so proud when this heavenly being appears to him
After floods in 1966, UNESCO made efforts to save this Italian city & its treasures, like the Biblioteca Marciana
The Zuiderzee Flood of 1287 killed 50,000 but also connected this then-village to the sea, & the rest is Dutch history
In 1887, 1931 & 1938 northern China was devastated by flooding of the Huang He, this colorful river
A dam collapse in this state led to the deadly 1889 Johnstown Flood
2010-11 floods in Australia were exacerbated by this Pacific Ocean weather phenomenon with a feminine name
The  Lumières' autochrome color photo plate used a layer of dyed starch particles from these vegetables
Ocean sediment may be made up of coccolithophores, these tiny organisms, 6 billion to the square foot
During an epidemic of this disease in 1796, Edward Jenner discovered the power of vaccines & used it to save lives
From 1979 to 2009 physicist Stephen Hawking was the Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at this university
When boiling water, energy absorbed that escapes as vapor is this type of heat, from Latin latere, "to hide"

rounds.text: In a 1980 National Book Award winner, we learn this title character gets his name from the rank of his late dad--technical sergeant
